newsitem.title: UK: IPE crude oil futures rise on back of NYMEX comple.
newsitem.headline: IPE crude oil futures rise on back of NYMEX comple.

text.p: IPE crude oil futures moved to trade at slightly higher ground on Monday afternoon after the NYMEX complex rose further than expected, traders said.

July Brent was trading 8 cents up at $19.48 a barrel by 1505 GMT, having hit a high of $19.55 a little while earlier, and June gas oil was $1.25 a tonne higher at $173.25, after trading earlier at about 50 cents down.
NYMEX's WTI July contract was 9 cents up at $20.97 and gasoline was $0.34 cents up at 63.15 cents a gallon.
"NYMEX's TWI is better bid now," one trader said.
He thought July Brent would try to test its next resistance level of $19.63.
"If it (July Brent) is going to turn around, it is because gasoline is doing something," a second trader said shortly before the rise, as Brent futures were still trading at lower positive numbers.

But he said that Brent was range-bound, not interested in testing drastically higher or lower ground, adding that an earlier short-lived rally before NYMEX opened did not hold as selling set into New York and spilled over to London.
